intro: Alyssum pseudomouradicum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved alyssum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are narrow and linear. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Alyssum pseudomouradicum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
